questions.question: True or false: If you end up missing one of the online lecture quizzes for a good reason, such as being sick, you should immediately contact the professor about your situation and request an extension on the quiz.

answers.text: True
answers.comment: Extensions are not granted for the online lecture quizzes for any reason. Instead, the lowest three quiz scores will be dropped automatically for each student so that you won't have to take a zero on a quiz if you miss one or two due to being sick, having your internet go out at the last moment, etc. So, please do not contact your professor and ask for an extension if you miss an online lecture quiz. It may seem that there is no harm in asking, but it gets really tough for your professor to have to write back individually to several students after every quiz explaining that they won't get an extension because their lowest three quiz scores are being dropped for situations exactly such as theirs. Neither. Both Brad and Chloe are not going to pass the course.
Chloe is on track to pass. Brad is going to fail.

questions.question: Scholastic dishonesty, such as cheating on exams or plagiarism, is not tolerated in this course. BIOL 1009 is a required course for almost all students taking it. This means that the information covered in the course is information students will likely need to be successful in their future careers. As a result, committing scholastic dishonesty in this course is not only dis-honorable, but is also likely to negatively impact students' future careers. Because scholastic dishonesty is not tolerated in this course, students found to have committed scholastic dishonesty, such as cheating on an exam:

answers.text: will receive a grade of "0" on the exam or assignment affected by the dishonesty and will be reported to the university's Office of Community Standards.
will be given a second chance if they promise not to do it again.
will be given an opportunity to make up some or all of the points they lost by getting a "0" on an exam or other assignment.

questions.correct_answer: will receive a grade of "0" on the exam or assignment affected by the dishonesty and will be reported to the university's Office of Community Standards.

questions.question: Which of the following looks like a good study plan for an average student hoping to earn an above average grade of "B" or "A" in the course?

answers.text: For each topic, first spend ~1 hour doing the assigned reading and going over the handout while looking at the powerpoints for that that topic. Then, watch the recordings for each topic. Next, spend ~30 minutes reviewing the handouts/powerpoints and your notes from the recordings. As soon as possible after completing the above, spend ~1 hour answering study questions on the topic. Later in the week, spend at least 3 hours answering study questions or quizzes for all the topics covered up to that time.

For each topic, first spend ~1 hour doing the assigned reading and going over the handout while looking at the powerpoints for that that topic. Then, watch the recordings for each topic. Next, spend ~30 minutes reviewing the handouts/powerpoints and your notes from the recordings. As soon as possible after completing the above, spend ~1 hour answering study questions on the topic. Later in the week, spend at least 1.5 hours answering study questions or quizzes for all the topics covered up to that time.
answers.comment: This is unlikely to be enough time spent studying outside of class for an average student to earn a grade of "B" or "A".

questions.correct_answer: For each topic, first spend ~1 hour doing the assigned reading and going over the handout while looking at the powerpoints for that that topic. Then, watch the recordings for each topic. Next, spend ~30 minutes reviewing the handouts/powerpoints and your notes from the recordings. As soon as possible after completing the above, spend ~1 hour answering study questions on the topic. Later in the week, spend at least 3 hours answering study questions or quizzes for all the topics covered up to that time.
questions.general_comment: This is unlikely to be enough time spent studying outside of class for an average student to earn a grade of "B" or "A".

quizzes.quiz_title: Quiz 2 (due Thursday, Sept. 11 at 11:59 PM): BIOL 1009 (070-082) General Biology (Fall 2025)

questions.question: MgCl2 is an example of

answers.text: a compound
an element
a molecule
an organic substance

questions.correct_answer: a compound

questions.question: Electron shells

answers.text: may have only certain average distances from the nucleus and may have only certain energy levels
may have any average distance from the nucleus and any energy level
may have any average distance from the nucleus but may have only certain energy levels
may have only certain average distances from the nucleus but may have any energy level

questions.correct_answer: may have only certain average distances from the nucleus and may have only certain energy levels

questions.question: When a reversible chemical reaction reaches equilibrium,

answers.text: the forward and reverse reactions stop
the relative concentrations of reactants and products continues to change
the concentrations of reactants and products are equal
the forward and reverse reactions occur at the same rate

questions.correct_answer: the forward and reverse reactions occur at the same rate

questions.question: How many electrons do carbon atoms have in their valence shell?
How many electrons do nitrogen atoms have in their valence shell?
Pure water at room temperature has a concentration of 10-7 hydrogen ions (H+) and 10-7 hydroxyl ions (OH-). Why is this?

answers.text: Because at any given moment 1 in 1014 water molecules is broken apart into hydrogen and hydroxyl ions.
Because water will absorb oxygen molecules from the atmosphere and some of those oxygen molecules will combine with hydrogen atoms from the water.
Because at any given moment 1 in 103.5 water molecules is broken apart into hydrogen and hydroxyl ions.
Because at any given moment 1 in 107 water molecules is broken apart into hydrogen and hydroxyl ions.

questions.correct_answer: Because at any given moment 1 in 107 water molecules is broken apart into hydrogen and hydroxyl ions.

questions.question: What is the pH of a solution with a hydrogen ion [H+] concentration of 10-8 M?

answers.text: pH 2
pH 10
pH 8
pH 4

questions.correct_answer: pH 8

questions.question: If you mix a solid, hydrophilic substance “X” and a solid, hydrophobic substance “Y” with water

answers.text: X will likely not dissolve in the water. Y will likely dissolve in the water, forming a solution where Y is the solvent and water is the solute.
X will likely not dissolve in the water. Y will likely dissolve in the water, forming a solution where Y is the solute and water is the solvent.
X will likely dissolve in the water, forming a solution where X is the solute and water is the solvent. Y will likely not dissolve in the water.
X will likely dissolve in the water, forming a solution where X is the solvent and water is the solute. Y will likely not dissolve in the water.

questions.correct_answer: X will likely dissolve in the water, forming a solution where X is the solute and water is the solvent. Y will likely not dissolve in the water.

questions.question: Which of the following would you expect to dissolve poorly in water?

answers.text: A substance with a lot of polar covalent bonds
A substance with a lot of nonpolar covalent bonds
Anions
Cations

questions.correct_answer: A substance with a lot of nonpolar covalent bonds

questions.question: Discovery science

answers.text: focuses on testing predictions
focuses on formulating hypotheses
focuses on answering specific questions
focuses on accurately describing natural structures or processes

questions.correct_answer: focuses on accurately describing natural structures or processes

questions.question: Experimentation is only one part of the process of scientific inquiry, but it is a very important step because it

answers.text: gives the investigator a systematic, unbiased result
allows rejection of a hypothesis
ensures that the variable being tested is measured without error
ensures that hypotheses can be confirmed with certainty

questions.correct_answer: allows rejection of a hypothesis

questions.question: A hypothesis

answers.text: can NOT be proven to be correct or incorrect, regardless of experimental results
can be proven to be correct
can be proven to be correct or incorrect, depending on experimental results
can NOT be proven to be correct

questions.correct_answer: can NOT be proven to be correct

questions.question: A hypothesis must be testable and falsifiable to be scientifically valid. Being testable and falsifiable means that

answers.text: some conceivable observation or experiment could reveal whether a given hypothesis is incorrect
only a controlled experiment can prove whether a hypothesis is correct or incorrect
the hypothesis has been proved wrong
there must be several options in the hypothesis to chose from, one of which is correct

questions.correct_answer: some conceivable observation or experiment could reveal whether a given hypothesis is incorrect

questions.question: Polar molecules are often able to dissolve in water because

answers.text: The polar molecules attract each other, allowing water molecules to adsorb to them.
The polar molecules repel each other, allowing them to interact with the water molecules.
The partially charged regions of polar molecules are able to form hydrogen bonds with water molecules.
Polar molecules are able to fill their valence shells by transferring electrons from water molecules.

questions.correct_answer: The partially charged regions of polar molecules are able to form hydrogen bonds with water molecules.

questions.question: What is the pH of an aqueous solution with a hydroxyl ion [OH-] concentration of 10-12 M?

answers.text: pH 2
pH 12
pH 10
pH 4

questions.correct_answer: pH 2

questions.question: A solution with a pH of 12 contains what concentration of hydroxyl ions [OH-]?

answers.text: 0.01 moles/liter
2 moles/liter
10-12 moles/liter
0.12 moles/liter

questions.correct_answer: 0.01 moles/liter

questions.question: The charge on a water molecule is best described as being:

answers.text: Somewhat less than minus one near the oxygen atom and plus one near each of the hydrogen atoms.
Minus one near the oxygen atom and somewhat less than plus one near each of the hydrogen atoms.
Minus one near the oxygen atom and plus one near each of the hydrogen atoms.
Somewhat less than minus one near the oxygen atom and somewhat less than plus one near each of the hydrogen atoms.

questions.correct_answer: Somewhat less than minus one near the oxygen atom and somewhat less than plus one near each of the hydrogen atoms.

questions.question: A theory is

answers.text: a poorly supported idea that has little backing but might be correct
a concept that, once established in the scientific literature, can be modified but never rejected, even when new scientific methods produce data that don’t fit
a well-supported concept that has broad explanatory power
not correct unless it is several years old

questions.correct_answer: a well-supported concept that has broad explanatory power

questions.question: Qualitative data may be collected

answers.text: when carrying out discovery science or hypothesis-based science
only when carrying out discovery science
only when carrying out hypothesis-based science
only when carrying out numerical science

questions.correct_answer: when carrying out discovery science or hypothesis-based science

questions.question: The method of scientific inquiry that describes natural structures and processes as accurately as possible through careful observation and the analysis of data is known as

answers.text: qualitative science.
experimental science.
discovery science.
hypothesis-based science.

questions.correct_answer: discovery science.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about valence shells is FALSE?

answers.text: Electrons in the valence shell (i.e. valence electrons) are primarily responsible for the chemical behavior of atoms.
The valence shell is the outermost electron shell of an atom.
The number of valence shells contained by a particular atom is dependent on how many electrons that atom has.
The valence shell is the highest energy electron shell an atom has.

questions.correct_answer: The number of valence shells contained by a particular atom is dependent on how many electrons that atom has.

questions.question: Which of the following statements about chemical reactions is FALSE?

answers.text: When hydrogen and oxygen combine to form water, the hydrogen and oxygen molecules are the “reactants” of the reaction.
When hydrogen and oxygen combine to form water, the water molecules are the “products” of the reaction.
Chemical reactions may only proceed in one direction.
Chemical reactions involve the making and breaking of chemical bonds.

questions.correct_answer: Chemical reactions may only proceed in one direction.

questions.question: When two atoms share a pair of electrons, they

answers.text: form an ionic bond
form an electrical bond
form a covalent bond
form a paired bond

questions.correct_answer: form a covalent bond

questions.question: When an electron is moved further from the nucleus

answers.text: its potential energy may change, depending on how the electron was moved
its potential energy is unchanged
it loses potential energy
it gains potential energy

questions.correct_answer: it gains potential energy

questions.question: Electrons exist only at fixed levels of potential energy. However, if an atom absorbs sufficient energy, a possible result is that

answers.text: an electron may move to an electron shell closer to the nucleus.
the atom would become a negatively charged ion, or anion.
the atom may become a radioactive isotope.
an electron may move to an electron shell farther away from the nucleus.

questions.correct_answer: an electron may move to an electron shell farther away from the nucleus.
